notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Stained (especially first 7 leaves).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A fragment of a prayer book and a collection of halakhical works: Sefer mitsṿot ḳaṭan of Isaac of Corbeil, Hilkhot nidah of Isaac of Dueren, a compendium of Isur ve-heter of Isaac of Dueren by Susman of Regensburg, a compendium of the Or zaru'a of Isaac ben Moses of Vienna and Ḳitsur pisḳe ha-Rosh of Jacob ben Asher.

msItem.title: Sefer mitsṿot ḳaṭan ספר מצות קטן

supportDesc.foliation: Original Hebrew foliation, partially trimmed away.

collation.p: Quires of 8 leaves each, marked with catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi semi-cursive script, partially punctuated, of the 14th to 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather binding, blind tooled, with clasps. Boxed. Spine title: 'R. Isaaci de Korbeil. Liber Siman. R. Isaaci fil. Mosis Viennensis. Liber or Sarca. Etc. Hebraice. Brit. Mus. Iure Emptionis. 23,974.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: J. Leves: purchased from him by the British Museum on 13 October 1860: inscribed (folio [367v]).
